sub_topic: Solving systems of linear equations with complex coefficients
message_1:
Solve the following system of linear equations with complex coefficients:

3x + 2y + z = 5i

x - 4y + 5z = -2 - 3i

2x + 3y + 4z = 7 + 2i
message_2:
To solve the system of linear equations with complex coefficients, we can use the Gaussian elimination method. First, we will write the augmented matrix for the given system of equations:

```
|  3   2   1 |  5i  |
|  1  -4   5 | -2-3i|
|  2   3   4 |  7+2i|
```

Step 1: Eliminate x from the second and third rows.

R2 = R2 - (1/3)R1, R3 = R3 - (2/3)R1

```
|  3    2    1 |   5i   |
|  0  -4+2/3  14/3 | -2-3i-5i/3|
|  0  1/3   10/3 |  7+2i-10i/3|
```

Step 2: Eliminate y from the third row.

R3 = R3 - (1/5)(-4+2/3)R2

```
|  3    2    1  |   5i    |
|  0  -4+2/3  14/3 | -2-3i-5i/3|
|  0    0    2  |  6-11i/3 |
```

Step 3: Solve for z.

2z = 6 - 11i/3
z = (6 - 11i/3) / 2
z = 3 - 11i/6

Step 4: Solve for y.

-4y + (2/3)y + (14/3)(3 - 11i/6) = -2 - 3i - 5i/3
-(2/3)y = -2 - 3i - 5i/3 - 14 + 77i/6
y = (6 + 9i)/(-10/3)
y = -3/5 - 9i/5

Step 5: Solve for x.

3x + 2(-3/5 - 9i/5) + (3 - 11i/6) = 5i
3x = 5i - 6/5 + 18i/5 - 3 + 11i/6
x = (5i - 6/5 + 18i/5 - 3 + 11i/6) / 3
x = -1/5 + 13i/10

The solution to the system of linear equations is:

x = -1/5 + 13i/10
y = -3/5 - 9i/5
z = 3 - 11i/6
